name: Kung Pao Chicken
description: A popular Sichuan dish featuring diced chicken, peanuts, and vegetables, stir-fried in a spicy, sweet, and savory sauce.
steps: Marinate chicken pieces in soy sauce and cornstarch.
Heat oil in a wok and fry dried chilies until just beginning to blacken.
Add chicken to the wok and stir-fry until it turns white.
Add chopped bell peppers and scallions, stir-fry for a few minutes.
Pour in the sauce mixture of soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and water, and cook until thickened.
Stir in roasted peanuts and serve.
tips: Marinate the chicken for at least 30 minutes for best flavor.
Adjust the amount of dried chilies to suit your spice tolerance.
Serve with steamed rice to balance the bold flavors.
